lines: A young man walks up to you in the park and looks you square in the eye. "Have you got a dime?" he says.

You reach down into your pocket and slowly sort through the loose change. It's getting hard to discriminate the sizes and shapes of the coins these days. You finally find one that feels like a dime. You reach out and hand it to the
young man, who looks at you quizzically. "The TIME! The TIME," he keeps saying. Your hearing is beginning to go.

You know that older folks are more susceptible to robberies and other violent crimes than younger ones. Perhaps this young man is trying to set you up. If you try to run away, he will surely catch you. He is too large to fight.
#GIVE HIM THE DIME AND HOPE FOR THE BEST
#DO SOMETHING SILLY SO THAT HE THINKS YOU ARE CRAZY

You begin to sing "The Star-Spangled Banner" at the top of your lungs. The boy repeats, "Excuse me, Sir, do you have the TIME?" You must not have heard him correctly. Perhaps your hearing is beginning to fail.
